shortdef: an adult female human being
female or feminine
women collectively; womankind
traditionally feminine qualities or virtues
a female subordinate, servant, or employee
a female member of a group, team, etc
a wife, girlfriend, etc
to provide with women
to make effeminate

the state of being male or female with reference to socially and culturally defined characteristics of masculinity or femininity, or of having an identity that does not correspond to such characteristics
all the members of one sex
the state of being male, female, or neuter
a set of two or more grammatical categories into which the nouns of certain languages are divided, sometimes but not necessarily corresponding to the sex of the referent when animate
any of the categories, such as masculine, feminine, neuter, or common, within such a set
a physical or mental condition or illness that restricts a person in his or her ability to move or use his or her senses
something that disables; handicap
lack of necessary intelligence, strength, etc
an incapacity in the eyes of the law to enter into certain transactions
the state of having unique identifying characteristics held by no other person or thing
the individual characteristics by which a person or thing is recognized
the property of being one and the same individual
the state of being the same in nature, quality, etc
the state of being the same as a person or thing described or claimed
identification of oneself as
that relation that holds only between any entity and itself
that relation that holds only between any entity and itself
an assertion that that relation holds, as Cicero is Tully
an equation that is valid for all values of its variables, as in (x – y)(x + y) = x2 – y2. Often denoted by the symbol ≡
an equation that is valid for all values of its variables, as in (x – y)(x + y) = x2 – y2. Often denoted by the symbol ≡
a member of a set that when operating on another member, x, produces that member x: the identity for multiplication of numbers is 1 since x.1 = 1.x = x
a well-known person, esp in a specified locality; figure (esp in the phrase an old identity)
the people living in one locality
the people living in one locality
the locality in which they live
(as modifier)
a group of people having cultural, religious, ethnic, or other characteristics in common
a group of nations having certain interests in common
the public in general; society
common ownership or participation
similarity or agreement
(in Wales since 1974 and Scotland since 1975) the smallest unit of local government; a subdivision of a district
a group of interdependent plants and animals inhabiting the same region and interacting with each other through food and other relationships
